channel.title: iPod touch deadlocked
channel.description:
Alright, well I had a ton of shit on my iPod that I didn't want anymore so I went through the reset process. Just before I did this my iPod notified me of it's 20% battery life left. I figured that I'd have enough, so I proceeded. After about 30-40 minutes through, my iPod shut off. This was all while I was at the orthodontist's office, so I figured I'd wait till I get home to continue. When I plugged it in, it just gives me the Apple logo with a loading icon and it just sits there like that.
It also doesn't seem to charge, because after leaving it charging for about an hour or two it still told me that there was no battery to turn the iPod.
Anyone have any ideas on how to fix it?

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:19, topic:343822”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=440212.msg3245752#msg3245752 date=1277337850]
That’s so fucking gay, Cody. Now I’ll never be able to own you on Tap Tap Revenge 3.
[/quote]I’m getting the iPhone 4 soon, it’s ok.[/quote]
Yay I can own you soon then.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:14, topic:343822”]Try putting it in recovery mode. Hold the home button and the lock button down for 20 seconds then release the lock button and continue holding the home button for another 20 seconds. Should put it in recovery mode and will be forced to restore itself.[/quote]No ffs. I’ve said this literally like 5 times. I’ve already done this. I’ve known about this. This doesn’t work because it has no battery to reboot. It just sits there.

[quote=“Jc22493, post:16, topic:343822”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=440212.msg3242777#msg3242777 date=1277064974]
Ye, it’s jailbroken.

I can’t do anything at all. It won’t let me restart it because it doesn’t have any battery to commence the reboot. It won’t let me charge it either.
[/quote]
Well, if it doesn’t recognize the device, get a new cord. Then recover it.[/quote]It’s not the usb. My sister uses the same one and it works fine.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:13, topic:343822”]Ye, it’s jailbroken.

I can’t do anything at all. It won’t let me restart it because it doesn’t have any battery to commence the reboot. It won’t let me charge it either.[/quote]
Well, if it doesn’t recognize the device, get a new cord. Then recover it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I know why, it happened to me trying to add games to my ipod. It crashed and wouldn’t be read as an external hard drive, so i reset my computer and it recognized it.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Try putting it in recovery mode. Hold the home button and the lock button down for 20 seconds then release the lock button and continue holding the home button for another 20 seconds. Should put it in recovery mode and will be forced to restore itself.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Ye, it’s jailbroken.

I can’t do anything at all. It won’t let me restart it because it doesn’t have any battery to commence the reboot. It won’t let me charge it either.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

`Aaron:

Hold the top button and the home button for 30 seconds, it should flash and re-boot, that’s what happened with mine.

^ This.

Also, is it jailbroken…?

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:5, topic:343822”]Is your computer recognizing that the ipod is plugged in?[/quote]No, it doesn’t. It doesn’t open iTunes nor read it as an external device. I have a separate charger via outlet as well, but that doesn’t even charge it =.

item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

happend to my ipod nano because i added a 1gb overload of temporary memory to it so i could open it in my computer as an OS. I fucking killed it :’(

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

have you tryed holding down the hold button (the one at the top) and the menu button for like 10 seconds?
my friends had the same problem and doing the above fixed it.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

idk if this will work, mine whitescreen and shit onetime, but not sure why yours is still on the apple symbol, unplug it and reboot it, hold the button at the top and the home button (circle one) at the bottom and it should reboot, tell me if that works.

Read full topic

item.description:
